title: Hit Points
excerpt: A measure of your character's health and stamina. When your hit points drop to 0, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws.
markdown:
# Hit Points

Hit points (HP) represent a combination of physical and mental durability, the will to live, and luck. Creatures with more hit points are more difficult to kill.

## Maximum Hit Points

Your maximum hit points equals your Hit Die roll total (or the fixed value if you don't roll) plus your Constitution modifier, multiplied by your character level.

**At 1st level:**
- Maximum Hit Die result + Constitution modifier

**Each level after 1st:**
- Roll your Hit Die and add your Constitution modifier, or
- Take the fixed value (your Hit Die size / 2, rounded up + 1) + Constitution modifier

## Current Hit Points

Your current hit points can be any number from your maximum down to 0. Whenever you take damage, subtract it from your current hit points.

## Healing

When you receive healing, add the hit points regained to your current total. Your current hit points can't exceed your maximum.

## Dropping to 0 Hit Points

When you drop to 0 hit points, you either:
- **Die outright** if the damage equals or exceeds your maximum hit points
- **Fall unconscious** and begin making death saving throws

## Temporary Hit Points

Some spells and abilities grant [[temporary_hp|temporary hit points]]. These are lost first when you take damage and don't stack with other sources of temporary hit points.

## Regaining Hit Points

- **Short Rest**: Spend Hit Dice to recover HP
- **Long Rest**: Regain all lost hit points
- **Healing Spells**: *Cure Wounds*, *Healing Word*, *Prayer of Healing*, etc.
- **Potions**: Potions of healing restore hit points
